bibl.title: Dispatch from Henry May to William H. Seward, December 1, 1869
Despatches from United States Consuls in Gaboon, 1856-1888 T-466

body.div1:
Dear Sir, I have the honor to inform upon that, I arrived here upon the 3rd day of November 1869.
The vessel upon which I took pasasage from the United States was unavoidably delayed. Causing me to be much longer reaching this place than I anticiplated when I left New York.
In order to account for ant informaties that, may exist in the present, corespondence permits me to state that the book forwarded me from the departments of sate entitles Lestructions to Consuls and Commercial Agents was mislaid in America and has not yet reached me i would respectfully request that another book be sent to me.
sent to me
<pb facs="20170615_110531"
I have recieved information through Commandore Baron Divdeloh of the French fleet upon this coasr that there are two iron clad reven gun brats at the reslands of CAPE dE verdic, which had succeded in destroying a number of American Merchants vessels and wwell more in wait for the United States ship of Bar Saratoga supposed by them to be bound up the Coast. i have no information in regard to the whereabouts of the Saratoga. I have written yo yhr Coml. Agts. Monrovia and to CAPE palmas as they are the only points upon the Coast, where she would be likely to stop if found from down the coast Commondore J.B. recured his information through the Pourtegese Mail thush from the Lisbon to St paul de Loando.
By information received from the same source.(Commandere S.) from the spanish authorities at Fernando Po I have reason to as pretend. that the same difficulties that existed between the governments of the United States and Spain in the years 1859 and 1860 in relation too Spanish interference mth-Pomere Missionaries are likely to be received.
A copy of the regulations of the Hon. Secretary of Treasury to Which reference is made in Circular of 17 of July 31st 1862. has not reached me.
I have the honor to be Your most obi. servant Henry May Com.Agnt.
